verses.verse: Hear <WH8085> this<WH3548>, O ye priests, and hearken<WH7181>, O house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>, and give ear<WH238>, O house<WH1004> of the king<WH4428>; for unto you pertaineth the judgment<WH4941>; for ye have been a snare<WH6341> at Mizpah<WH4709>, and a net<WH7568> spread<WH6566> upon Tabor<WH8396>.
And the revolters<WH7846> are gone deep<WH6009> in making slaughter<WH7819>; but I am a rebuker of them all<WH4148>.
I know<WH3045> Ephraim<WH669>, and Israel<WH3478> is not hid<WH3582> from me<WH669>; for now, O Ephraim, thou hast played the harlot<WH2181>, Israel<WH3478> is defiled<WH2930>.
Their doings<WH4611> will not suffer<WH5414> them to turn<WH7725> unto their God<WH430>; for the spirit<WH7307> of whoredom<WH2183> is within<WH7130> them<WH3045>, and they know not Jehovah<WH3068>.

And the pride<WH1347> of Israel<WH3478> doth testify<WH6030> to his face<WH6440>: therefore Israel<WH3478> and Ephraim<WH669> shall stumble<WH3782> in their iniquity<WH5771>; Judah<WH3063> also shall stumble with them<WH3782>.
They shall go<WH3212> with their flocks<WH6629> and with their herds<WH1241> to seek<WH1245> Jehovah<WH3068>; but they shall not find<WH4672> him<WH2502>: he hath withdrawn himself from them.

They have dealt treacherously<WH898> against Jehovah<WH3068>; for they have borne<WH3205> strange<WH2114> children<WH1121>: now shall the new moon<WH2320> devour<WH398> them with their fields<WH2506>.
Blow <WH8628> ye the cornet<WH7782> in Gibeah<WH1390>, and the trumpet<WH2689> in Ramah<WH7414>: sound an alarm<WH7321> at Beth-aven<WH1007>; behind<WH310> thee<WH1144>, O Benjamin.
Ephraim <WH669> shall become a desolation<WH8047> in the day<WH3117> of rebuke<WH8433>: among the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> have I made known<WH3045> that which shall surely be<WH539>.
The princes<WH8269> of Judah<WH3063> are like them that remove<WH5253> the landmark<WH1366>: I will pour out<WH8210> my wrath<WH5678> upon them like water<WH4325>.
Ephraim <WH669> is oppressed<WH6231>, he is crushed<WH7533> in judgment<WH4941>; because he was content<WH2974> to walk<WH1980> after<WH310> man<WH6673>'s command.
Therefore am I unto Ephraim<WH669> as a moth<WH6211>, and to the house<WH1004> of Judah<WH3063> as rottenness<WH7538>.

When Ephraim<WH669> saw<WH7200> his sickness<WH2483>, and Judah<WH3063> saw his wound<WH4205>, then went<WH3212> Ephraim<WH669> to Assyria<WH804>, and sent<WH7971> to king<WH4428> Jareb<WH3377>: but he is not able<WH3201> to heal<WH7495> you<WH1455>, neither will he cure you of your wound<WH4205>.

For I will be unto Ephraim<WH669> as a lion<WH7826>, and as a young lion<WH3715> to the house<WH1004> of Judah<WH3063>: I<WH2963>, even I, will tear and go away<WH3212>; I will carry off<WH5375>, and there shall be none to deliver<WH5337>.

I will go<WH3212> and return<WH7725> to my place<WH4725>, till they acknowledge their offence<WH816>, and seek<WH1245> my face<WH6440>: in their affliction<WH6862> they will seek me earnestly<WH7836>.
